Idiom (Tamazight): Ur iɛeḍ ara waman iɣ iden
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Fixed clause, negative form with verb 'ɛeḍ' (to return)
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Used to describe someone who never learns from their mistakes or refuses to change their behavior.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Widespread in the Souss region; reflects the importance of wisdom in Tamazight oral tradition.
First Example Sentence: Ur iɛeḍ ara waman iɣ iden, yellan am win ur isus ara.
Second Example Sentence: Ma t-iniḍ yakan, ur iɛeḍ ara waman iɣ iden.
Third Example Sentence: Ad iɣen ur iɛeḍ ara waman iɣ iden, imi ur yettusawal ara.

Idiom (Tamazight): Tifawin ur tettwasegri ara s tament
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Negative fixed clause with metaphorical noun phrase
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Happiness cannot be built on lies.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Deceit never leads to lasting happiness.
Usage Contexts: Moral reflection, family discussions, social advice
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common across central and southern Morocco; moral proverb often told by elders.
First Example Sentence: Tifawin ur tettwasegri ara s tament, imi tidett iḥebb tafukt.
Second Example Sentence: Yessawal babaɣ, 'Tifawin ur tettwasegri ara s tament.'
Third Example Sentence: Iɣ iɣur ur ttwasegri ara s tament, ur yesɛa tafukt.

Idiom (Tamazight): Abrid ur yettwazal ara s yiwen udrar
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: No path is made by one mountain alone; collaboration is essential.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: One person cannot achieve everything alone.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to the mountainous Amazigh terrain symbolizing collective effort.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Tamazight): [æbrið ur jættwæzæl æræ s jiwen uðrɑr]
First Example Sentence: Abrid ur yettwazal ara s yiwen udrar, imi ur ttru ara iɣer.
Second Example Sentence: Ur yeggi ara asirem, abrid ur yettwazal ara s yiwen udrar.
Third Example Sentence: Tamurt ur tettwazal ara s yiwen udrar.

Idiom (Tamazight): Ur yezmir afus i yefka tafukt
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Effort alone cannot replace fate or divine will.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from ancient Amazigh agricultural worldview valuing destiny and labor.

Third Example Sentence: Ur yezmir afus i yefka tafukt, tidett d waman.

Idiom (Tamazight): Amuddu ur ittwafaq ara s yiman-is
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: A journey without self-knowledge cannot succeed.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common in literary Tamazight, echoes moral lessons in folk tales.

Second Example Sentence: Ma t-iniḍ, aẓru ur iɛer ara s tɣuri.
Third Example Sentence: Ad d-iniɣ fell-ak, aẓru ur iɛer ara s tɣuri.
